data.title: Adventure Riddles List
data.meta_description: This is a list of all known riddle answers for Adventuring. Use "CTRL + F" to find the one you are looking for. If you only need hints about what the symbols represent, view the Adventuring page.
data.text:
Louise Hill[]

Riddles Answers Worn clothes and rough hands bearing the burden of his work; pesky children mean he doesn't always get to reap what he sows; yet, he persists. A figure of solidarity, the land knows him well. Bearnard As I was raised, I drank the tears of the sky and ate the luminous rays of the sun, and with time I give back to the people that raised me. Plant A riddle for you!

My determination knows no bounds My resolve has been set I will continue unbound And chase my goals with no regrets What am I?

Tenacity When the sun arrives, I try to join it in the sky. But when the cold comes, I freeze. Beware of falling into me, you may catch a cold. Rain Sweet when underneath the ground, bitter up on top, when the music starts to pound, you can let me drop Beet ""If you love them, let them go,"" they say,

But to do so without letting their feelings convey Is sabotage that world-hoppers shouldn't downplay, Lest their future together is what you wish to betray.

Honour Find me at the tip of a fiddlehead fern,

Or peep me at the end of a chameleon tail, I carve myself in countless turns, A mysterious pattern is my trail.

Spiral I can disappear or appear where I please but a swirl of destruction is left behind me. Tornado I bring relief from scorching heat,

or drive the cold deeper into your bones. I am gentle, like a caress, or violent, like beating fists. I spread life, but sometimes destruction. What am I?

Wind A battle on the horizon, a soldier stands steadfast with her spear. You cannot kill the brave one, who fights like dawn is near. Which am I? Tenacity Above heads of tranquil dreamers, invisible at dawn, Far-off, faint and feeble, from the sun, they stay withdrawn. As the blue, cloudless haze dons its silk black gown, Boundless cosmos shine their light down. What am I? Stars What do an ox, a rat, and a human all have in common? Animals Traveling, traveling, busy in the air, bustling, bustling, to the fields for which we care. Tending to the farm work, but no hoe or hose. Both feeding and feasting on the flora in rows. What am I? Bees A little building full of lights, many sparks, what a fright!

Take your chance if you are near, but bring a turnip or don't come here!

Buli A bond deep and strong, carried through the veins. It won't

be forgotten, though just a scar remains.

Honour A budding rose and twisting leaves. Planted in patches in more rows than three. Plants A bushel of me is a bushel to eat. Grind me up, and mix up fine. Let me rise, and bake me. What color am I unground? Wheat A calm grassy hill, sun shines from above. They rest to their fill — before farming must be done! They get up from slumber, awake from their nap. Stretch real long and put on their cap. The work is hard, but they won't delay! What keeps them going and refrain from their play? Tenacity A carpet rich beneath your feet, a meal for the herd to eat, and in me hide the clovers sweet. Beware the dew if you take a seat! Grass Sick with envy or down with the flu, my cheeks turn what dreadful hue? Green A cobblestone path, worn from years of use.

The first meeting, gruff, but a welcome sight to confused eyes. A traveler's knapsack, destination unknown.

Bearnard A creature crows in the morning to wake you from rest. What is the color is his handsome crest? Red Adventure-tales can be a relief to get through: what colour paints the surface beneath fluttering sails? Blue Aeolin’s breeze blows dandelion seeds, all throughout the hills. Before they seed, when just a flower, what color is a dandelion? Yellow A farmer's day starts before I'm even up

and doesn't end until I'm down once again

Sun The fox cheers her on, eye filled with awe, applauding each hit with a delighted 'Aha!' She's daring! Bashful! Gracious! Her training is ever... Tenacious In nature I'm a rare sight indeed, though one look up is all you need. Birds and bugs display me well, but I rarely grace a mammal's pelt. In irises of both kind I am seen, yet some eyes can't perceive my sheen. In your glass the water lacks a hue, but in vast amounts, I appear. I am... Blue After a long summer, what do the crops anticipate more than anything? Rain After you've planted a seed, watered it and gave it nutrients, what is the last thing you need to give it? Sun A full moon's harvest, just when the weather turns cold

Leaves in warm shades, people in warm clothes, animals in warm coats The weather is turning, and the farmers are praised, for all the crops they've worked to raise So relax, kick back, and settle by the fire, basking in its warmth.

Autumn A hard work turning loamy soil,

under endless beating sun, But with this virtue, bear this toil, Determination 'til it's done!

Tenacity A golden sun drips into the deep blue sea, and that's all it take for you to meet me.

What am I?

Color green A kiss to break the wicked spell, end the curse in the tales we tell. What is needed there, to make our heroes persevere? True love A million tiny lights all glow and punctuate the night's endless dark. How lovely it is to know that, of millions, we can tell each one apart. Which am I? Star Sacred am I, yet I'm even more rare.

Wars have been fought over me, But it only seems fair. The brave, the courageous, the hardworking know, once you attain me, it's something to behold.

Honour An ear twitches as a ruddy coat bristles; The hunter makes their strike. What am I? Animal A riddle! Down and down and down we go! Twisting, turning, to and fro! A view to the skew what you know and knew, dizzy yet? We're almost through! Where are we? Spiral A riddle! Every rose is a sunset for the eye. I’m the color nature chose to not be shy! Red A riddle for you: Dripping deep in the heart, it flows, trickles through the cracks, and glows. What is it? Lava A riddle for you: I fall, touch the earth, and die - yet once again I rise. What am I? Rain Here's a little ode to sing: The skies of blue above the fields of green, Roads of brown and aqua streams; Clouds of white and stars so clear, Hearts of warmth for loved ones so dear. Now, the color of home is... Red (Home is where the heart is?) A riddle! What color sings out when springs out, out when birdsong rings out? Green As a canary knows a coal mine, as a rooster knows the dawn. I hear the question and its answer. I am almost never wrong. Which am I? Comprehension I live but a few hours

Yet guide you all your life So many times forgotten When in a different light

- With each step that is taken, something new there is to learn. Those who venture to seek me, this is what they always yearn. Wisdom/Knowledge As endless as the sea. As hopeful as the sky. I am every single sadness. I am there when you cry. Which am I? Knowledge As winter ends and melts away, leaving the land a blank slate, it is nature's way of returning once more, in hopes of fulfilling its fate. The first signs of life rise from the unyielding ground, and one by one the flowers emerge, leaving the viewer spellbound. Spring A thousand hours to build me up

A thousand soldiers to defend me I am the sweetest you may ever taste And time cannot destroy me What am I?

Honey A whisper in the wind you barely hear. A night sky filled with questions. The flower blooms for a reason. Which am I? Thought I tick and I tock, I thump and I mutter, and beautiful things may just set me aflutter! What am I? Heart Hatched from a teapot, hear me purr, Admire my beautiful gradient fur. I love sunshine and a good pat. Tell me, what is the color of my hat? Blue (Apprentice Cat) Some say he is what he says he is not;

Other that he has many an abstract a thought. Everyone knows him as just a strange man with a potato machine- But if they just look closer, they'll realize he has powers unseen.

Old Farmhand Be it four legs, or one; twenty-five, or three. I skitter, hop, slink, and pop, as far as the eye can see! Nature is home, across it I roam: What am I? Animal Books and scrolls all bound and creased, histories and recipes for finest feast, time growing me will best any beast. What am I? Knowledge Breaking a sweat from dusk til dawn

to harvest produce on ones farm A bear's strength to reap reward what sort of diligence describes Bearnard?

Tenacity Busy as a bee, stubborn as a mule, working day by day on what type of fuel? Honey Can you solve this riddle? What grows, has skin, thrives in the light, but isn't a person? Plant Cabbage and broccoli, lettuce and onion, plenty of colours under the sun. But a common vegetable colour is this one. Green Change can hurt, but bear the storm. When the wind's done whipping up the sand, the weather will be gold and warm and you'll find a new path on which to stand. Which am I? Tenacity Clever and cautious, curious to the core, Every time you see her, she always asks for more. Experiments and secrets hidden behind every locked door; What color are the painted walls where you can find her store? Blue Close your eyes and imagine this! Grass to graze on, pastures and fields under bare, muddy feet: color me blind, but what hue should I use for where cloven animals bleat? Green Countless and immeasurable

Endless like the sea Hailed upon in love and life Your fate's to do with me

Stars Despite each harsh word, I hold grasshoppers I've caught so tender. Everyday I'm calling you absurd, each childlike moment showing I'm a pretender. I simply want a friend, so all I ask of you is an ear to lend. Calbet Enjoy the sweet crunch of freshly picked apple

While bright leaves take on shades of red orange and purple Falling leaves, we'll rake them them into large piles, and when the day's gone, sip a warm drink with smile

Autumn Energy ebbs and flows through all. Like heat in home, song in all. The universe roams come night or day. Stardust in your soul will always stay. Galactic Fall is red and spring is vernal. Learn from the resting winter ground: though nature's beauty is eternal, no plant can bloom all year round. Not cactus, flower, herb or bean, nor human, animal or elf, is ever truly evergreen so be gentle to yourself! Which am I? Summer Feathers, hides, skins, and furs. Mother Nature shares what's hers. But treat these gifts with respect. Balance is what herders protect. Animals Feet on the earth, look to the air, you'll never see it on the ground. After rain it's often there. When you find it go five colors down. Blue Fire burns in many hues, silver and sapphire, ruby and gold. The hottest blaze is winter's blue the reddest glow is the most cold. So why do we think of heat as red when blue's the hotter counterpart? Because its gentle fire that bakes our bread, And comforts our body, soul, and heart. Which am I? Warmth Fluttering from one stem to another, a velvet lady drinking her morning tea. Ladybug For my fortune, you must search amongst my verdant fellows. Though, I may be more common than legend claims me to be. What am I? Four-leaf clover For winters and nights, soups and stews; to bring delight, and cure your blues. What am I? Tomato? From soil, sunlight, and raindrops' flow

In due time you'll watch me grow. What am I?

Plant From the depths we push our way up, reaching toward the heavens. We dance with the light and feed from rain. Who are we? Plants Hello, a riddle for you. I'm something life can't live without, what am I? Water Hello, a riddle for you. The sun keeps everything alive, but even the stars cannot live without me. What am I? Heat Hello, a riddle here! Millions of realities make a trillion bits of dirt and gas meet in numbers that hurt your head as energy combines into massive balls of light and heat. What am I? Stars Hello, here's a riddle. Who is your guide and bright-souled friend, still to be followed long after they're dead? Stars Hello, I have a riddle here. Something impossible to reach, and yet all around you. What is it? Infinity Hello, I have a riddle here. What is coveted by one animal, yet always protected by many? Honey Here's a riddle for you! A glowing tail of light, moving at high speed thorugh the skies and only visible at night Shooting Star Here's a riddle for you. A peddler sells you magic boots that make run farther than you ever could before, but you can't use them to escape. You ask what kind of magic the boots are enchanted with. What is his answer? Honour Here's a riddle for you. A sunflower grows seeds, yummy golden treats! Who needs superpowers if one eats what one sows? A farmer is one lucky fellow: his favorite color? Yellow Here's a riddle for you. Treasured, hoarded, measured, and awarded: what am I? Gold Here's a riddle for you: What lies in wait for the mathematical mind, unbound from conventional knowledge, to find? Infinity Here's a riddle: I have a beginning but no end, a size but no value, three eyes but no lashes. What am I? Infinity Here's a riddle, I'll keep trying even after a hundred failures. What am I? Tenacious Here's a riddle! I'm as magical as sorcery, as glamorous as grace; yet wielding me takes more than just a pretty face!

What am I?

Charm Here's a riddle. In me, you'll always be without direction; I am remorseless, unceasing collection. What am I? Spiral Here's a riddle: What loses ground, but keeps time? Hourglass Honey takes determination from every single golden bee. They can't give up on its creation or cut corners with the quality. Which am I? Tenacity Hop the fence and look around: leafy green vegetables abound! Wonder, is he a farmer, or a hoarder? Despite your order, Leave the field un-ransacked, but with this intact: Honour Hot peppers, your eyes start to water, why? You think, did you bother to eat, these veggies are cursed, you think! What color is your face? Red Autumn brings the cold, the turnips are poor. Winter has stalled time, there are no crops to grow. Spring rolls in, there is work to be done. I am a cycle, I am... Seasons How about a riddle? Toss a stone into a pond, and watch the water; I'll respond. What am I? Ripples How many bits are between one and two? Between two mirrors, how many reflections will you view? With riddles like these, counting takes a vacation. What's the answer, then? Add imagination! Infinity I am a cloud on the ground

I follow crooks around

Honour I am a house with four separate rooms. Sense of direction is lost within my walls, when you are going left you are actually going right. I am of great importance in my town, connecting everything. Everything depends on me, or risk falling apart. Heart I am a traveler, journeying far, My home was the mountains where the bluebirds are. I run downhill, I gurgle and roar, My destination is the shoreline where the seagulls soar. Water I am dangerous

I can singe your skin But every night You gather around me With your kin. Who am I?

Fire I am not a person. I am not an animal. I am not an illness. Yet I'll bring ruin to early spring sprouts. Frost I am tall, vibrant and so hard to ignore. When it comes to the sun, I am always looking for more. And when my time is over, I'll leave you with a snack that many adore! Sunflower I am the bane of gardeners, and the friend of small children. I love puddles, but I hate the sea. I never go home, yet I'm always there. Who am I? Snail I am the cow's favourite meal when pastures are covered in snow by the winter. I am the horse's favourite bed after a long day outside of trot and canter. But stay away if you have a fever or if you're looking for a needle. Hay I am the language of the bards, thieves, tricksters, rogues and con men.

I can spin stories of silk, lies, flattery, falsehood and often, I am the one who will lead you astray if those who hold me use me cruelly.

Charm I am trapped within an eternal cycle. From death to birth, from flesh to ash... I watch as the world around me grows older, as I grow younger. Only my life, and my life alone is everlasting. Phoenix? I am what makes the turnips grow and the seasons change. Do not wait for me, for I am already there; you will not see me until you look back. Time I always lurk within you. Indulge in me, and I consume you. Although I can be a volatile fuel, tempering me can make me a deadly tool. What am I? Passion or anger I beat and breathe, I skip and break. I'm not a record, I'm not a drum. Which am I? Heart Through the bitter seasons, stark and white

Through the cold howling winds and eerie moonlight Like a lighthouse in the storm, I'll keep you safe and warm

Fire When night falls and all are asleep, what dots the skies and watches over Bearnard's farm? Stars I can run and babble, but cannot stumble or quiet. What am I? River I curtsy and bow, the wind blows through my dress, the leaves at my fingertips, finesse at it's best. Trees? I dye the earth in my color, sprouting up to give birth to beautiful sights. I signal the new year, new beginnings, new life. Grass I enter like a thief, at the window of your mind alighting. It's been long since I visited last; I never listen when you call. But still, I'm welcomed - I always bring something exciting, and you come happily into my thrall. Who am I? Inspiration I have the most colorful house in this little town, All the other houses are just plain brown. My many experiments keep me engrossed, What is the one trait that I lack the most? Honour If you die with this, you never truly end. The people paint and write your stories. Tales of swords and spears. And all your former glories. Which am I? Honour I glide from the sky onto the ground.

All life on this planet can be traced and found Back to me What am I?

Sun/Sunlight? I have a mysterious past

and come from a land without rain My friendship is strong and will last, I won't cause those I love any pain. Who am I?

Fantasia? I have a riddle for you! A little home for a little mind, and only slime trails left behind. What am I? Snail Shell I have a riddle for you. Seeking, finding, learning, minding, on a journey ever winding: who am I? Galactic I hide in a snail, but not a slug. You may see me in a storm, but not a clear sky. You can even find me as you stir your morning coffee. What am I? Spiral I hold the direction from which the sun rises

And in which it sets Yet neither way do I look What am I?

Horizon I know you are coming but cannot hear you. I eat but do not swallow. You marvel at my majesty but cower at the hollow. Which am I? Night I leave a trail wherever I go,

Whether walls or leaves or trees, And with me, always, my home.

Snail I'm baking a blueberry pie! The ingredients I need are flour, sugar, eggs, and...? Blueberries I'm kept inside a drawer, somewhere alongside the forks. Though far less-used, I'm what you choose whenever you need something uncorked. What am I? Corkscrew I may seem mischievous Perhaps somewhat devious I have several experiments To some I’m an irritant But I’m just quicker! A sneaky turnip picker! Buli In myths, they say the wisest are immortalized in the night sky so that they can guide beyond their years and educate after they die. Which am I? Constellations Inside the soil- despite the toil-

a plump specimen grows. At least it will until it wakes- a fiend is ready, bound to take as soon as they do know. And back again the farmer tends to what is left to sow. Who is the thief?

Buli In the darkness of the night, Hark! It's Bearnard's window lights! Though they glow gold, there's something more, inside his shack smoulders the core! Fire/Embers In the face of adversity and outstanding odds, when all seems lost and for naught, stand strong young warrior and rally your strength, for only with me are such battles fought. Honour In this season, crops have grown from tiny seeds that once were sown. Bearnard harvests all his crops to bring new goods into his shop. Autumn I promise that I'm not what you think! There really is not a link between my robes and my wand- I task you to correspond I'm just a simple aide This is not a charade! Though perhaps in my past A few spells I may have cast... Old Farmhand I repeat unerringly, changes coming sparingly; yet, do not despair in me, lest you lose your clarity. What am I? Time It buds and it blooms, then tie a knot to keep it everlasting. What am I? Love It is not that I seek only the answer, but instead aspire to understand the question too. Who am I? The Old Farmhand It lights our spirits in times of trouble. Its sight stops crimes from creeping by as injustices mount without reason why. What salvages goodness from the rubble? Honour It may be the mask that we wear on the surface, but it is also the hand that pulls at the strings, merrily guiding us all around as it pleases. - It may seem like Buli is just causing trouble, for the poor old bear whose farmwork is now doubled; if you ask her why, she'll likely turn you away, but show some interest and she may have something to say. What does she talk to you about? Comprehension I touch everything below me, the crops, which grow when I look upon them, the people, who bask in my glory, the sea and its surface creatures too. What am I? The Sun Working the land til' your senses are keen, this is the colour your thumb will then seem. Green Thumb I've got a riddle for you! An inexplicable sign from an unconventional mind: what am I? Spiral I've got a riddle for you! If you nourish the earth, I will always return, what am I? Plants I’ve taken over these rolling hills, wielding countless blades, without winning a single battle. What am I? Grass You may know me as black.

You may know of my hosts, the fleas, the rats. I mean not be morbid, but I do mean you harm. It is simply in my nature to spread, to alarm

Germs/Plague I vow to oppose all evils, but always give a second chance. What is the virtue of merciful heroes, like Lilia and her mighty lance? Honour I would wear a nest of Jays in my hair then don a squrrel just for flare. What am I? Tree Known to make a famous sauce and bright red in colour, I’m considered a fruit rather than a vegetable, though many are skeptical. What am I? Tomato Let our glow guide you below to all directions you seek. Just remember where we shine: our positions change by the hour, day, and week! Stars Life unravels as travels turn inward. The gravel of time is scattered windward. Your footsteps recurve, over and over again! If this is a cycle, how does it halt, and when? What are you in? Timeloop Like sunshine sparkling on the sea pushing to the plants below. Humans don't stop when the path is steep because there's amazing things to help grow! Which am I? Tenacity Louise Hill is plenty safe, no danger to bring you harm. Come here for a pleasant time, it's got a lot of...! Charm Loyal to the very end, and loving from the day you met, always' have been man's best friend, as much partner as is pet. Which am I? Dog Many parts I've dreaded. On me many have depended. Yet this isn't the life I intended. To me no helping hands were extended.

A new life, a new beginning, A simple life, one I face grinning. Labour of love, every day singing a song for which my heart was craving. Who am I?

Old Farmhand Mindful of my wardrobe,

but adventuring I want to go. I stay here to protect, Those I've come to know. Who am I?

Lilia My brain can sail through time and space. My blood can pump from toes to face. But flaws in plans fill me with sorrow. I regret the past, and fear tomorrow. What am I? Infinity My rays coax flowers to bloom

Cause roosters to crow And chases away the gloom What am I?

The sun Nestled between verdant hills, I wait for the drops of natures thrills, My depth dictates what I need, And as it falls I take with greed. What am I? Plants What's that sound, profound in the morning?

What's with that cry, sky still dim and warming? What's that racket, blanket tucked and cozy? what's making that crow, though the sun's not rosy?

Rooster Never forget your quaint, humble start. Without their help, you'd be a goner. You pledge to revisit, with all your heart- a promise you'll make sure to... Honour No matter how the earth has turned the stars are the same when you look, just like the knowledge in a book, steadfast, waiting to be learned. Which am I? Facts Nothing you do can quite make me see red, than helping my green nemesis instead. Who am I? The Old Farmhand Not the mightiest of swords but I impale the sky, I was here long before there were eyes. Firm in my place like Excalibur in the stone.

My edges are sharp with many a clone. What am I?

Tree Now that you're here, look to your right. Or left; choose one but don't delay. You mustn't stay here until night. Lest the fair folk come and spirit you away. Where are you? Crossroads Of lustrous leaves and shining rays, I enrapture all those that capture my gaze. What am I? The Sun One stays out and works all day, while the other rests and watches; still, they have something in common. What is it? Honour On some nights, the sky over Louise Hill will open, rain nourishes Bearnard's crops, wind puts an end to Calbet's arrows, and in flashes, the black-grey is replaced with what? Lightning Our songs fall silent on this frosted glen, echoes of another When. What can echoes teach us now? Look around, friend, and find out how. Elves Our stories shine like gold. Our hopes stem from lives lived well. But without each other's ears to tell, what fun is growing old? What are we? Friends Over and over, never-ending

If you squint it's still descending It whirls, directionless, the path unclear Everything's a blur, where is it here?

Spiral? Paws and claws and teeth and tails, sniffs and kisses from a wet nose, fur and fluff and beaks and scales, and teeny tiny bean-like toes! Which am I? Animals Riddle me this: I'm your best bet, your ally-maker, your charisma set, your confidence-faker: I'll lead you from harm. What am I? Charm Riddles, riddles, riddles: At the bottom of worrying, truth; but without me, you'll find no proof as the mind fiddles and frets What am I? Knowledge Riddle Time! Cause and effect; connect the dots right and left! Follow the branches as options cleft out of sight, only to pause, lose track, and re-link despite crossing back like Dawn chasing Night's theft. Spiral Rolling hills and verdant greens,

The first villager that you've seen Is one very heart-warming bear, Who embodies this trait the best and cares.

Tenacity Rooted deep underground, I grow and I anchor. When the cold comes round, I may wither. What am I? Plants Rumpled or smooth, purple or green, I'm perfect raw, pickled or steamed, what am I? Lettuce Running or still, sparkling or dull, thundering or as an ever-so-quiet whisper. What am I? Water See if you can solve this riddle. All around me, only space, and stars make up my brilliant face. What am I? Galaxy She has elegance and she has grace and she has more than a pretty face. Day after day, rain after shine, she perfects her technique and persists over time. Lilia She stands out from the crowd,

Each experiment openly curious, And her crimes are downright proud, Though her true heart is spurious.

Buli Some bathe in me; some worship me, and the roost's eponymous king extols me with his shrill voice. What am I? Sunlight Some need sun and some need shade, to be flooded, or watered gently, strongest in the desert or in glade, different seeds succeed differently. Which am I? Plants Some may say it's a funny thing, it's all about how the ways may swing. For you, better or worse, no matter how it twists and turns, it swings true to its words. Best for you to continue on your way, and you'll make it there someday. Hope? Sparks soar through the air

Barely missing golden hair Another theory tested with flair In a scientific secret lair

Buli Stars dapple my surface, reflections of the heavens above me. Though night is beautiful, vast, and deep, I harbor that which it can never have. Silver slivers swim through my depths, and friendly symphonies sing at my banks. What am I? River Stars intertwined, thoughts combined, many lose grasp of it. Comprehension Stealing turnips like a thief in action, Am I a child or a demon? Scientific experiments I perform, House yellow and blue in a thunderstorm. Very understanding am I, but also very sly. Buli Such as the rooster crows, such as the farmer sows. Each day we make our mark until the sky must grow dark. The rhythm of the beat is no easy feat unless this strength is what you meet. Tenacity Swords and slings clamored, armor singing, heroes hammered! When fear of battle strikes the soul, what keeps one bound upon their role? Honour Take a cloth of midnight blue, hold it taut before a light. Take a pencil, poke it through and in your hands you'll hold the night. The more you poke the pencil in you'll make the shapes sailors rely on. Two bears, a bull, a set of twins, two dogs, a crab, and a lion. Which am I? Constellations Tears and scrapes derail our goals. With whips and scorns does bad luck crack! But as triumph and failure both unpack, how does a hero balance these roles? Tenacity The two of us stand, in the background. Minding our business, fluffy and round. What are we? Chickens The fair folk flocked through sacred meadow and dale. Though we are long-gone now you may still learn from our tale. What were we? Elves The farmer works the days away, tending to the crop, but what is it he requires, in order to sell his harvest at the shop? Charm The fireflies outside my window Sway and glow and flicker In death and life they bring to me My people running quicker They bow to me, queen or king, And spring into my hold Single, double, cause no trouble, Close your eyes, let stories unfold. - The golden sand drips through the hourglass, with hope of joy and fear of sorrow. But either way the time will pass, one today is worth two tomorrows! Which am I? Time The horizon calls, adventure awaits. Today's the day we find our fates! But adventurers are fools without following through. Nothing finishes without me: It's true! What am I? Tenacity The miles and years cannot hold me. The reign of winter melts at my touch. The hope of another summer molds me. Much like lovers, fools, and such! What am I? Warmth The more you poke the pencil in you'll make the shapes sailors rely on. Two bears, a bull, a set of twins, Two dogs, a crab, and a lion. Which am I? Stars The Old Farmhand likes to say that I am the source of all things. What am I? Knowledge There was an old fellow who worked on a farm

Has a beard, wore robes, and a very large hat But make no mistake, though a wand he has, Because a wizard, he is definitely not

Old Farmhand The sky is just a void without me

You need me to see me I am here day and night If you lose me, you lose sight

Light? The smell of apples, the burning beat of war drums: what color grapples with a passion that hums? Red The stars do not ask how it is they came to be. The planets do not ponder their place in the sky. For knowledge, new and ancient, is within. We need only ask 'why?' Which am I? Comprehension The sun bows its head as the lion lifts her gaze. Never resting, never still. Moving silently from land to hill. It does not walk, nor run. All is cool when it is done. What am I?

of the clouds above

what are we?

my lure will catch them all the same.

Silvie's Mine[]

Riddles Answers A city unfazed by night, a practice untouched by the light. However, the luster burns hot. This decision may be your final - your last shot. Crosshair A companion in uncertainty and friend in darkest night, I'm small enough to hold in hand yet strong enough to bite. What am I? Canary A glittering grave, and lifeblood cured. What am I? Amber? A golem draws strength from the place they were born. I am what awaits them, should they venture too far.
